objects.name: Analytic 1473
objects.description: Detects anomalous CI/CD workflow execution originating from forked repositories, with pull request (PR) metadata or commit messages containing suspicious patterns (e.g., encoded payloads), coupled with the use of insecure pipeline triggers like `pull_request_target` or excessive API usage of CI/CD secrets. Correlation with unusual artifact generation or secret exfiltration via encoded or external network destination URLs confirms suspicious behavior.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: saas:github
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Workflow triggered via pull_request_target from forked repo

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: saas:github
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Artifact generated includes base64/encoded exfil payload or URL

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: saas:RepoEvents
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: New file added or modified in PR targeting CI/CD or build config (e.g., `gitlab-ci.yml`, `build.gradle`, `pom.xml`, `.github/workflows/*.yml`)

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: saas:PRMetadata
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Commit message or branch name contains encoded strings or payload indicators

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Time delta between PR creation and workflow execution to flag rapid attempts
Forked or external user accounts triggering workflows; may differ across orgs
CI trigger types (e.g., `pull_request_target`) that should or shouldn't be used for forks
Entropy threshold for detecting encoded payloads in artifacts
Rate of secret access in a single workflow run that might indicate abuse
